intro: Arnebia linearifolia subsp. desertorum, commonly known as the desert bugloss, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its linear, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit make it well-suited for xerophytic environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
